Instruction:
Task Description: Implement a WebSocket client class in JavaScript using Node.js that establishes a connection to a WebSocket server, handles incoming messages, and manages connection events.

Class Description: The WebSocketImpl class provides a wrapper around the Node.js 'ws' library to create and manage WebSocket connections. It handles connection establishment, message reception, error handling, and connection closure events. The class also provides methods for sending data and closing the connection.

Attributes:
- _globalObject: [Object] - The global context in which the WebSocket operates
- _ownerDocument: [Object] - The document object associated with the WebSocket
- _urlRecord: [Object] - Parsed URL information for the WebSocket connection
- url: [String] - The WebSocket server URL as a string
- _ws: [WebSocket|null] - The underlying WebSocket instance or null if not connected
- _readyState: [Number] - Current connection state (0 = CONNECTING)
- _requiredToFail: [Boolean] - Flag indicating if the connection should fail
- bufferedAmount: [Number] - Amount of buffered data in bytes
- _sendQueue: [Array] - Queue of messages waiting to be sent

Methods:
- constructor(globalObject, args, privateData) -> [void] - Initializes the WebSocket connection with the given parameters and sets up event handlers
- _onConnectionEstablished() -> [void] - Internal method called when the WebSocket connection is successfully established
- _onMessageReceived(data, isBinary) -> [void] - Internal method called when a message is received from the server
- _onConnectionClosed(code, reason) -> [void] - Internal method called when the WebSocket connection is closed
- close(code, reason) -> [void] - Closes the WebSocket connection with optional code and reason
- send(data) -> [void] - Sends data through the WebSocket connection (supports strings and Blob objects)
- get readyState() -> [Number] - Returns the current ready state of the WebSocket connection
